definitions.definition: A person whose occupation is to clean floors, windows and other things.
A device that cleans, such as the vacuum cleaner.
A substance used for cleaning, a cleaning agent.

(in the plural) A professional laundry or dry cleaner (business). (This form is now interpreted as plural and usually spelled without an apostrophe, even in official usage, to justify the removal of the apostrophe. It was traditionally spelled cleaner's with an apostrophe because this is grammatically correct, as can be seen with forms such as go to the doctor's, which cannot be reinterpreted as plural.)
definitions.example: I'll have to take this shirt to the cleaners.

definitions.definition: (heading, physical) Free of dirt or impurities or protruberances.
(heading, behavioural) Free of immorality or criminality.

definitions.example: I’ll need a sharper knife to make clean cuts.  a clean leap over a fence
Wow, Dude, those are some clean shoes ya got there!

definitions.definition: (health) Being free of sexually transmitted diseases (STDs).
definitions.example: I want to make sure my fiancé is clean before we are married.

definitions.definition: That does not damage the environment.
Free from that which is useless or injurious; without defects.
Free from restraint or neglect; complete; entire.
